intro: Hypselodelphys triangularis, commonly known as the triangular hypselodelphys, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
